title: To Kill a Mockingbird
summary: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality told through the eyes of a young girl in the Deep South.
A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother.

title: Pride and Prejudice
summary: A romantic novel that also critiques the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

title: The Great Gatsby
summary: A novel about the decline of the American Dream in the 1920s.

title: Moby Dick
summary: A narrative of the adventures of the wandering sailor Ishmael and his voyage on the whaleship Pequod.

title: War and Peace
summary: A historical novel that chronicles the French invasion of Russia and its impact on Tsarist society.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
summary: A novel about the events in the life of a young man named Holden Caulfield.

title: The Hobbit
summary: A fantasy novel that follows the quest of home-loving Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by Smaug the dragon.

title: Fahrenheit 451
summary: A dystopian novel that presents a future American society where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: Jane Eyre
summary: A novel that follows the emotions and experiences of its eponymous heroine, including her growth to adulthood and her love for Mr. Rochester.
